intro: Diasperus claussenii, commonly known as the Clausen's spurge, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species of spurge plants. The plant is characterized by its succulent, ribbed stems and small, clustered yellow flowers. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, making it well adapted to dry conditions. Diasperus claussenii is often used in rock gardens due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
